national_indicator_description: This indicator shows the percentage change (latest year on previous year) in Gross Domestic Product (GDP) (Average) per capita at market prices.
goal_meta_link_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (PDF 232 KB)
computation_definitions: Gross Domestic Product (GDP) is the main measure of the size of the economy, representing the total value of all final goods and services produced in a defined time period. The ONS has published What is GDP? and GDP and me to explain what GDP is and how it relates to everyday life. Quality and methodology information for the UK GDP measure can be found here.
graph_title: Annual growth rate (%) of real GDP per capita
source_other_info_1: The time series used for this indicator is N3Y6 in tab 1.1.5 (Gross domestic product at market prices, percentage change, latest year on previous year). To view earlier data you will need to unhide rows in the spreadsheet.
other_info:
Data going back to 1956 are available from the UK Economic Accounts (see Sources tab).

Data follows the UN specification for this indicator, with the exception that values have not been converted to US dollars. This indicator is being used as an approximation of the UN SDG Indicator. Where possible, we will work to identify or develop UK data to meet the global indicator specification. This indicator has been identified in collaboration with topic experts.
